title: How to Do the Google Gravity Trick in Your Browser

steps.title: Open a JavaScript-enabled web browser.
steps.content: Open a JavaScript-enabled web browser. Launch a browser like Chrome, Edge, Safari, or Firefox, which all support JavaScript. You can even use the browser on your phone! If you disabled JavaScript in your browser, you'll need to enable it to use Google Gravity and other Google games and Easter eggs. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://www.google.com in your browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.google.com in your browser. You'll need to be on the main Google search page to play with Gravity.

steps.title: Type google gravity into the search bar and click I'm Feeling Lucky.
steps.content: Type google gravity into the search bar and click I'm Feeling Lucky . The "I'm Feeling Lucky" button, which is just below the search field, takes you directly to the Gravity version of the Google search page. At first, the search page will look normal! But once you move your mouse, the buttons, menus, images, and other elements on the page will fall to the bottom, mimicking gravity. If you donâ€™t see the "I'm Feeling Lucky" button, you can just press Enter and then click the top search result (the Mr. Doob site).
